solution_line_template: Celia has budgeted ${food_budget_per_week} a week for {num_weeks} weeks for food, ${food_budget_per_week} x {num_weeks} = $<<{food_budget_per_week}*{num_weeks}={monthly_food_cost}>>{monthly_food_cost} worth of food for the month.

She has one monthly cost of ${rent_cost} for her rent + ${streaming_cost} for video streaming services + ${cell_phone_cost} for her cell phone = $<<{rent_cost}+{streaming_cost}+{cell_phone_cost}={total_fixed_monthly_costs}>>{total_fixed_monthly_costs} of single monthly costs.

Celia wants to set aside {savings_percent_text}% of the ${monthly_food_cost} + ${total_fixed_monthly_costs} = $<<{monthly_food_cost}+{total_fixed_monthly_costs}={total_monthly_spending}>>{total_monthly_spending} for her savings account.

{savings_percent_text}% of her savings account is {savings_percent_decimal} x {total_monthly_spending} = $<<{savings_percent_decimal}*{total_monthly_spending}={savings_amount}>>{savings_amount} to add to her savings account.
